pageContext.claim: “Number one, they say it's not a campaign finance violation. Number two, or it's not even under campaign finance -- number two, if it was, it's not even a violation. Number three, it's a civil matter.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump Attorney Michael Cohen pleaded guilty to violating campaign finance laws at the direction of Trump when he made pay-offs to women that alleged they had affairs with Trump. The hush-money payments were violations of the law because campaign spending is regulated. You can only accept money under certain conditions, you can only spend that money under specific conditions, and that spending needs to be reported.
